Last year our school held a masquerade ball with the theme of super heroes. One of our students wanted to dress up as a Puerto Rican, female super hero. It’s not as easy as one might think. She did some research and discovered La Boriqueña, a super hero created by famed comic book writer Edgardo Miranda-Rodriguez. She eventually got to meet him and share her love for this incredible hero.

Fast forward to today. Our young friend was presenting to her sisters about the impact of this character in her life. She spoke about the importance of her Puerto Rican heritage and how she has learned that every single girl could be a super hero. What she didn’t know is that her parents arranged for Mr. Edgardo to come to her presentation.
(Mr. Krzyzostaniak, Girls Prep Bronx) #DiscoverGirlsPrep #FutureIsFierce #RepresentationMatters #GirlHeroes

On Friday morning, a group of our 8th grade scholars connected via Skype with the San Ignacio de Loyola Academy in San Juan, Puerto Rico. In the conversation, the students were able to share with a second grade group.

Both groups of students exchanged their experiences related to weather, atmospheric systems, storms, and hurricanes. In addition to practicing languages, our girls had the opportunity to practice Spanish and students in Puerto Rico their English.

It was a wonderful experience for everyone and we hope to communicate again. Reach out to Lorraine Roque if you would like to hear more!

Some of our scholars received new glasses on the spot thanks to our supporter and Namesake, Billie Jean King, and partner, Pearle Vision.

We recognize that having the proper prescription in their glasses relieves some of the anxiety that scholars experience related to attending school. If your scholar wears glasses make sure they are using them as needed, and bringing them from the first day of school through the entire school year.
